data.title: Acceptance rate, ranking, fees, and more! -
data.meta_description: Are you planning to study at Duke University? This blog will tell you all about its courses, fees, rankings, and scholarships. Read now!
data.meta_site_name: Study Abroad Blogs | All about universities, programs, tests, & more!
data.text:
Duke University | Here’s everything you should know!

Duke University, founded in 1838, is a private institution located in North Carolina, USA. Since it has a total undergraduate enrollment of 6,717 (fall 2020), it follows a semester-based academic schedule. In the 2022 edition of Best Colleges, the University is ranked ninth among National Universities.

Duke university has 3 campuses in Durham and a maritime site near Beaufort, totaling over 8,600 acres. The main campus, designed mainly by Julian Abele, mixes Gothic architecture with the overpowering presence of Duke Chapel.

Moreover, the campus’ centerpiece seats almost 1,600 people! In addition to being the seventh-richest private institution in the United States, Thomson Reuters also added 32 of its professors to its list of highly cited researchers in 2014.

Duke University is North Carolina’s second-largest private employer and is associated with 10 Nobel laureates and 3 Turing Award winners. Its most recent academic accomplishments include 3 students being designated Rhodes Scholars in 2002 and 2006.

Additionally, to the pleasure of Harry Potter enthusiasts worldwide, Duke researchers also released the first practical example of an invisibility cloak in 2006.

Why should you choose Duke University?

Duke has around 15,000 students, the vast majority of whom are postgraduates. The student-to-faculty ratio is 8:1, which personalizes the learning experience. Moreover, most Duke students reside on campus, making use of the university’s world-class athletic facilities and completely immersing themselves in student life.

In addition, over 400 student groups–cultural, faith-based, political, and service-based – exist at Duke. They promote student connection and exchange and assist students in developing their interests and passions.

Duke University | Top courses that you can pursue

Undergraduate school

Undergraduate programs at Duke University are classified into two parts: Liberal arts and Engineering. You’ll be able to choose among 53 majors, depending on your interests, including-

Mathematics

Global Health

Environmental engineering

Russian

Visual arts

Romance studies

Arts and humanities

Engineering and technology

Life Sciences & Medicine

Natural sciences

Social sciences and management

Others

Graduate school

The graduate school at Duke University offers approximately 70 certifications, master’s degrees, and PhDs, including-

Arts and humanities

Business & management

Engineering & technology

Life sciences & medicine

Natural sciences

Genetics & genomics

Earth & ocean sciences

Molecular cancer biology

Public policy studies

Psychology & neuroscience

Arts and humanities

Business & management

Engineering and technology

Life Sciences and medicine

Natural sciences

Social Sciences and Management

Tuition and expenses

Students must cover their expenditures for food, lodging, laundry, transport, and other necessities. An estimated budget for international students looking to study at Duke University is given below.

Tuition

Additional costs

Duke University | Everything you should know about rankings

QS World University Rankings, 2022, place it at 52nd number.

Times Higher Education has ranked Duke university as the 5th best in the world in 2022.

Times Higher Education ranks it 23rd in the World University Rankings for 2022.

U.S. News and World Report rank it 9th among the best national universities in 2022.

U.S. News & World Report states that Duke University ranked 13th for Best Undergraduate Teaching & Value Schools in 2022.

Duke University | Everything about the admission process

Admission to Duke University is exceedingly competitive, requiring a tremendous academic and general background. Duke’s acceptance rate for the Class of 2024 is under 6%, making the admissions process exceedingly difficult.

Portal of application: (Choose to apply using either the Common Application, Coalition Application, or QuestBridge Application).

Documents required

Official transcripts from prior educational institutions.

International candidates must submit the results of their English proficiency tests.

Personal Essay.

Statement of purpose.

3 letters of recommendation.

ACT or SAT scores

Personal Interview.

Graduate admittance may necessitate the GRE/GMAT and additional tests depending on the subject.

Duke University | Campus and accommodation

There are two recreation centers on-campus, Brodie Recreation center and Wilson Recreation Center.

In addition, they provide free group fitness classes, personal trainers, aquatics facilities, physical education, and outdoor adventure options.

The school has over 400 student clubs and organizations to select from, including student government, special interests, and service groups.

The above facilities guarantee that the students are stimulated as well as rejuvenated, allowing them to concentrate on their studies.

Duke University | Scholarships

Duke University provides a multitude of scholarships and incentives to overseas students studying in the United States. Moreover, the university covers all the students’ proven needs. The institution permits its students to earn USD 2,200 each year through its work-study programs. Around 54% of undergraduate students get financial help, while 64% of graduates finish debt-free.

Candidates can choose from a variety of low-interest student loan choices.

The following are some ‌scholarships available at the institute –

1. University Scholars Program

This program is open to students undertaking multidisciplinary research. This scholarship’s grant value is flexible.

2. A.B. Duke Scholars Program

This merit-based scholarship program recognizes students with academic and professional leadership potential. The entire value of this scholarship is around 315,000 USD, which is distributed over four years.

3. Karsh International Scholars Program

This grant is given to outstanding students who can make a worldwide impact. The award covers tuition, fees, lodging, and board, as well as documented needs that exceed those costs. It also offers up to 7,000 USD for research and service possibilities.

Key takeaways

Duke University is a highly selective university in the United States that offers high-quality education.

The university has produced several successful individuals, including two US presidents.

In addition to contemporary academic infrastructure, the institution offers prospective students a wide choice of sports and entertainment.

The institution provides several scholarships and financial aid to students with limited financial resources.

Furthermore, the university is steadfast in offering great placement to its students with some of the world’s best hirers.

Therefore, the aforementioned factors are the primary reasons overseas students choose to study at Duke University.

We hope you enjoyed reading this blog. In case of any doubts, you can reach out to us or drop a comment below and share your thoughts!

Liked this blog? Read next: 7 Best countries to study in Europe | Top universities, fees, & more!

FAQs

Q1. What distinguishes Duke University?

Answer- Outside of the classroom, Duke University, noted for its academic philosophy fosters multidisciplinary work. Thus, as a result, Duke University provides a rich environment where students may explore the world around them, from academics to athletics to art.

Q2. How difficult is it to get into Duke?

Answer- In the 2019-20 admissions season, Duke’s acceptance rate was 8.2 percent. Even though in 2020-21, it was only 5.8 percent, it was the lowest rate in school history.

Q3. How many overseas students are admitted to Duke University?
